title: Watch these BASE jumpers leap from a hotel roof
description: Two men with parachutes jumped from the 25th floor rooftop bar of the Nashville Grand Hyatt. Witnesses say the men, who were hotel guests, landed in a nearby parking lot.

title: In a stunning one-hour phone call reported by The Washington Post, the US President tells a Georgia official, 'I just want to find 11,780 votes'
description: President Donald Trump pushed Georgia Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger to "find" votes to overturn the election results after his loss to President-elect Biden, according to an audio recording of a phone call obtained by The Washington Post.

title: Covid-hit Manchester City cruises to win at struggling Chelsea
description: Manchester City shrugged off the loss of six players to Covid-19 to beat Chelsea 3-1 on Sunday to reignite its English Premier League title challenge.

title: US braced for 'total collapse of the health care system' after holiday season Covid surge
description: Hospitals around the United States are racing to keep up with surges of Covid-19 patients at numbers they have not seen at any other time in the pandemic.

title: Washington Post: In call, Trump demands Georgia officials 'find' votes to tilt election
New Republican election stunt signals a new breed of Trumpism
description:
• Nearly a dozen GOP senators announce plan to vote against counting electoral votes
• Analysis: Republicans are to be in a terrible political position

title: How Georgia got to the center of the US political universe
description: Georgia may feel teleported to the center of the US political universe, but its emergence as a swing state has been a long time coming.

title: Congress prepares to reconvene for a rare Sunday session
description: The 117th Congress will officially be sworn in on Sunday, bringing an influx of new lawmakers to Capitol Hill in the midst of the ongoing pandemic.

title: Police arrest 2 people and fine 6 for violating Quebec's Covid-19 lockdown orders at a 7-person house party
description: Canadian police arrested two people after an illegal New Year's Eve party violated Quebec's Covid-19 lockdown protocols.

title: Two men with parachutes leap from hotel roof
description: Two men BASE jumped from the rooftop bar of the Grand Hyatt hotel in Nashville on Friday, causing a "mass panic" among the bar's patrons, police said.

title: Petra Vlhova crowned 'Snow Queen' as Mikaela Shiffrin takes fourth
description: Slovakia's Petra Vlhova was crowned "Snow Queen" of Zagreb for the second straight year after claiming the World Cup slalom event as four-time winner Mikaela Shiffrin finished back in fourth.

title: Nancy Pelosi must count carefully ahead of House speakership vote Sunday
description: House Speaker Nancy Pelosi has a slim margin for error on Sunday when lawmakers return to Washington to officially usher in a new session of Congress and elect their new speaker.

title: Boris Johnson warns Covid restrictions are about to get tougher
description: Coronavirus restrictions in England are "alas probably about to get tougher," UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson said Sunday, as the country battles to rein in a deadly surge in coronavirus infections.

title: Pence 'welcomes' congressional Republicans' bid to challenge electoral votes
description: Vice President Mike Pence on Saturday signaled his support for a bid by Republicans lawmakers to challenge electoral votes when Congress is expected to certify President-elect Joe Biden's victory in a meeting this week.

title: Fareed: Trump and the virus have had 1 common consequence
description: CNN's Fareed Zakaria says world leaders like President Trump are fueling an uptick in nationalism as countries grapple with the pandemic.

title: US surgeon general: 'No reason to doubt' Covid-19 death toll number after Trump claims deaths 'exaggerated'
description: US Surgeon General Dr. Jerome Adams on Sunday said he has "no reason to doubt" the US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention's Covid-19 death toll, contradicting President Donald Trump's claim that the agency has "exaggerated" its numbers.

title: Pope criticizes people going on holiday to avoid Covid-19 lockdowns
description: Pope Francis has condemned people who traveled abroad for a vacation and avoid Covid-19 lockdowns, adding that holidaymakers were not considering the effect of their actions on others.

title: Tapper: Republicans are siding with 'insanity' over fact
description: After some congressional Republicans announced they would challenge President-elect Joe Biden's victory by voting against counting electoral votes next week, CNN's Jake Tapper asks why members of the GOP would side with the President with no credible evidence suggesting widespread voter fraud.

title: 10 easy ways to 'Go Green' in 2021
description: Have you noticed an increase in extreme weather events? With wildfires growing in size, hurricanes getting stronger and mass flood events becoming more commonplace, it's the Earth's response to the way humans treat it.

title: Mike Pence is in a weird spot
description: "And now for something completely different," John Cleese routinely intoned between absurdist sketches on "Monty Python's Flying Circus."  He might have been wearing a tuxedo or a pink bikini, and on one occasion he said it while appearing to be roasting on a spit.

title: Golf is booming because of the pandemic
description: The pandemic has popularized a lot of unexpected activities. Remember when everyone was doing puzzles and baking bread? Thanks to social distancing, the sport of golf has seen a resurgence, too.

title: Democrats may make history in Georgia's Senate runoffs
description: Poll of the week: My average of Georgia polls shows the two Senate runoffs on Tuesday are within the margin of error and way too close to call.

title: Saying goodbye to a wild year for stocks
description: We're hoping to shelve the word 'unprecedented' for a while as 2021 gets underway — but first, one final look at a 2020.

title: America can't hide from this drastic reckoning
description: What happens to a nation incapable of healing itself?

title: A Wendy's manager is trying to change the world one 'I love you' at a time
description: In a year of despair and a world full of hate, one fast food manager is doing what she can to spread a message of love.

title: Japan's geishas feeling the impact of coronavirus pandemic
description: Japan's iconic geishas are struggling to survive as the centuries-old profession faces unprecedented challenges from the coronavirus pandemic. CNN's Selina Wang reports.

title: More people are moving to Georgia than ever before. Many are bringing their Democratic politics with them
description: Andrew Lu moved to Georgia in 2017. By 2018, he was canvassing for Stacey Abrams' gubernatorial campaign.

title: Attorneys for men charged in death of Ahmaud Arbery don't want him called a 'victim' in court
description: Lawyers for Gregory and Travis McMichael, the father and son charged with murder in the death of Ahmaud Arbery, are asking that Arbery not be called a "victim" in the trial because they say it would be prejudicial, according to one of several motions they filed in the last days of December.

title: These former nurses were asked to leave retirement and return to the front lines
description: Juliana Morawski has realized that she most likely couldn't go back to working in an emergency room, even if she wanted to. As a retired emergency nurse of 30 years, that realization is hard for someone who just wants to lend a helping hand on the front lines.

title: 3 missions prepare to explore Mars and other space news to expect in 2021
description: It's time to go deeper into space.

title: Otherwise normal house for sale hides nightmarish surprise: An entire abandoned jail
description: A house for sale in Vermont has everything a new homeowner could want: four bedrooms, two bathrooms, a nice backyard and ... prison cells.

title: Suspect in custody after shooting at a Virginia Walmart
description: A sheriff's deputy and two civilians are being treated for serious injuries at a hospital after a suspected shoplifter opened fire at a Walmart in Sterling, Virginia, northwest of Washington, D.C., authorities said Saturday.

title: Dangerous Covid-19 conspiracy theories are here to stay
description: At a recent Saturday protest outside London's Stratford train station -- comprised of bindi-wearing hippies, conspiracy theorists in balaclavas, and middle-aged men in waterproof jackets -- a protester with the grassroots, anti-lockdown group StandUpX yelled into a megaphone.

title: Israeli soldier shoots and paralyzes Palestinian man in dispute over power generator
description: An Israeli soldier shot a Palestinian man, leaving him paralyzed from the neck down, after an altercation over a portable electric generator, according to the Palestinian Ministry of Health.

title: Homes of McConnell and Pelosi are vandalized
description: The homes of the two highest-ranking members of Congress — House Speaker Nancy Pelosi and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell — have been vandalized, police said, after the Senate stalled Friday on increasing stimulus checks to $2,000 for millions of Americans.

title: Small plane crashes into Michigan home, killing three
description: Three people are dead after a small plane crashed into a house outside Detroit, according to the Oakland County Sheriff's Office.
